data.name: Rayquaza

abilities.name: Speed Gain
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Fire Energy card or a basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza. This power can't be used if Rayquaza is affected by a Special Condition or if you have another Rayquaza in play.

attacks.name: Sky Judgement
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Rayquaza.

data.flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Entrancing Melody
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

data.name: Grovyle

abilities.name: Sunshine Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby), and remove all damage counters from Magby.

attacks.name: Detour
attacks.text: If you have a Supporter card in play, use the effect on that card as the effect of this attack.

data.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

data.name: Volcarona

abilities.name: Heat Cyclone
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

data.name: Rillaboom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Forest Feast
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Grass Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Lampent

abilities.name: Freefloating
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Pignite

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When it trouble, it emits smoke.

data.name: Cacnea

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: It prefers harsh environments such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu. If you do, this attack does 80 damage.

data.flavorText: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.

data.name: Typhlosion

abilities.name: Fire Recharge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Fire Pokémon. This power can't be used if Typhlosion is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and does 20 damage to Typhlosion. If tails, this attack does 60 damage.

data.flavorText: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.

data.name: Feraligatr

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

data.name: Ho-Oh-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Phoenix Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Phoenix Burn during your next turn.

attacks.name: Eternal Flame-GX
attacks.text: Put 3 in any combination of Fire Pokémon-GX or Fire Pokémon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Dwebble

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: The Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

data.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Hind Kick
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.

data.name: Buizel

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

data.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Primal Claw
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

data.name: Barbaracle

abilities.name: Hand Block
abilities.text: If you have a Stadium card in play, your opponent can't attach any Special Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

data.name: Darkrai
rules: Enigma Berry: If Darkrai is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Fighting Pokémon, remove 4 damage counters at the end of that turn.

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Roar of Time
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for 3 Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If you don't have 3 Pokémon in your discard pile, this attack does nothing.)

data.name: Fomantis

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.

data.name: Team Aqua's Cacnea
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Double Fire
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A flame burns inside its body. It scatters embers from its head and tail to sear its opponents.

data.name: Wailmer

attacks.name: Lullaby
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it lands on beaches to bounce like a ball and play. It spouts water from its nose.

data.name: Team Magma's Groudon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Magma Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Magma Quake
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Lava Burn
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Smoochum

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Smoochum is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Smoochum by attacks.

attacks.name: Energy Antics
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. Smoochum is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its lips are the most sensitive part of its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.

data.name: Machoke

attacks.name: Pummel
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

data.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap
abilities.text: At any time during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it to 1 of your other Pokémon. If you do, choose a type of Energy. Electrode is now an Energy card of that type (instead of a Pokémon) that provides 2 energy. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

abilities.name: Miracle Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), discard a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, choose a basic Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Togetic is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Mini-Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required in order to use that attack.) (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Togetic is still Colorless.) Togetic performs that attack.

data.name: Omastar

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Primal Tentacles
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, and Old Amber in your discard pile.

data.flavorText: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

data.name: Mightyena δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Darkness Metal type.

attacks.name: Delta Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gang Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Darkness Pokémon and Metal Pokémon you have in play.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

data.name: Tangrowth

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Chlorowhip
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 2 Grass Energy attached to it, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

data.name: Dark Charizard

attacks.name: Continuous Fireball
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Discard a number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard equal to the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Seemingly possessed, it spews fire like a volcano, trying to burn all it sees.

data.name: Tirtouga
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Cover Fossil

abilities.name: Prehistoric Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon on the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. It swam skillfully and dove to depths beyond half a mile.

data.name: Slurpuff

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across water.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Edge
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Path-GX
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Synchronize
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokémon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

data.name: Rillaboom VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Beating
attacks.text: You may discard up to 3 Grass Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 50 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Axew

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

data.name: Rotom

abilities.name: Mischievous Trick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your face-down Prize cards with the top card of your deck. This power can't be used if Rotom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Plasma Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

data.name: Heatmor

attacks.name: Hot Lick
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Durant, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

abilities.name: Thick Fat
abilities.text: Any damage done to Grumpig by attacks from Fire Pokémon and Water Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Circular Steps
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's), excluding Grumpig.

data.name: Emboar-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Orbeetle V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mysterious Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

abilities.name: Pattern Distraction
abilities.text: As long as Spinda is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent's Basic Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. You can't use more than 1 Pattern Distraction Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Whimsy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Spinda does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Quilava

attacks.name: Mini Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is an Energy card, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

data.name: Meganium

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Meganium.

data.flavorText: Meganium's breath has the power to revive dead grass and plants. It can make them healthy again.

data.name: Blaziken

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Burning Shot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 150 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It can clear a 30-story building in a leap. Its fiery punches scorch its foes.

data.name: Sawsbuck

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The plants growing on its horns change according to the season. The leaders of the herd possess magnificent horns.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Giant Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Encore
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can use only that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Break Beam
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Golduck is now Confused.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that lives in lakes. It swims faster than any human swimming champion.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Magnetic Trip
attacks.text: If Low Pressure System is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Alomomola

attacks.name: Super Deep Dive
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

attacks.name: Needles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sandstorm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Wobbuffet

attacks.name: Counter
attacks.text: If an attack damages Wobbuffet during your opponent's next turn (even if Wobbuffet is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Wobbuffet attacks the Defending Pokémon for an equal amount of damage.

data.flavorText: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Wind Wave
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 5 in any combination of Pokémon and Supporter cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Explosive Smoke
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It's drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

data.name: Clefable

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Clefable's type is still Colorless.)

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Clefable during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: A timid Fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people.

data.name: Celebi ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Time Reversal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Celebi ex from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for a card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Shield
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Celebi ex by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Tyranitar

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Ground Burn
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 80 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.

data.name: Mantine

attacks.name: Healing Wave
attacks.text: Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.

data.name: Wimpod

attacks.name: Gnaw and Run
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's nature's cleaner—it eats anything and everything, including garbage and rotten things. The ground near its nest is always clean.

abilities.name: Night Vision
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Sableye is your Active Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Sableye is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Limitation
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter Cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Fire Immunity
abilities.text: You can't attach Fire Energy cards from your hand to Moltres.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach 1 of them to Moltres.

attacks.name: Burning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Moltres.

data.name: Quagsire

abilities.name: Laid-Back
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Mud Gun
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn't care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Bebop Punch
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.

data.name: Light Ledian

attacks.name: Flash Touch
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, switch 1 of them with Light Ledian. As long as that Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, it can't become Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. (All other effects of attacks, Pokémon Powers, and Trainer cards still happen.)

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The number of spots on its back increase or decrease depending on the number of stars visible in the night sky.

data.name: Regigigas

abilities.name: Slow Start
abilities.text: Regigigas can't attack until your opponent has 3 or less Prize cards left.

attacks.name: Crush Grip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 120.

attacks.text: Put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Lifting
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. For each Basic Pokémon you put onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ominous Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Uxie

abilities.name: Memory Out
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Uxie is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Uxie is Knocked Out), you may use this power. The Attacking Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mind Off
attacks.text: If you have Mesprit and Azelf in play, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Known as "The Being of Knowledge." It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

data.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Steelix by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Steel Swing
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.

abilities.name: Dark Lift
abilities.text: If Team Aqua's Carvanha has any Darkness Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Team Aqua's Carvanha is 0.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Poison
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Skarmory

attacks.name: Steel Coat
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Hitmonlee is an Evolved Pokémon, Hitmonlee's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Yanmega

attacks.name: Sonic Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pursue and Turn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has 2 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage and switch Yanmega with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.

data.name: M Manectric-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Bolt
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Torkoal.

abilities.name: Fan Action
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Benched Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Stadium Power
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Pichu

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Baby Steps
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a little electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.

attacks.name: Moonwatching
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch Crawdaunt G with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Kartana

attacks.name: Big Cut
attacks.text: If you have exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

data.flavorText: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

data.name: Lunatone

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Lunatone does 60 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

data.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Legendary Body
abilities.text: As long as Raikou is your Active Pokémon, Raikou and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this Power is active, discard any Trainer cards attached to Raikou. (This power works even if Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

attacks.name: Lightning Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that races across the land while barking a cry that sounds like crashing thunder.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from their hand during their next turn.

data.flavorText: Using psychokinesis gives it a headache, so it normally passes the time spacing out and doing as little as possible.

data.name: Larvesta

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

data.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters.

data.name: Shellos
data.flavorText: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Kangaskhan

attacks.name: Fetch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is three years old.

data.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

data.name: Wurmple
data.flavorText: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.

data.name: Feebas

attacks.name: Add-a-Dash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, draw a card.

data.flavorText: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

data.name: Inkay

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

data.name: Light Machamp

abilities.name: Tag Team
abilities.text: When you play Light Machamp from your hand, if it is on your Bench, remove 3 damage counters from your Active Pokémon. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Then, switch Light Machamp with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Beatdown
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Dark in its name or is a Darkness Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 damage instead of 50.

data.flavorText: It uses its four arms in combat to unleash a ceaseless flurry of punches.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

data.name: Emboar

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

data.name: Pichu

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Pichu is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Pichu by attacks.

attacks.name: Playground
attacks.text: Each player may search his or her deck for as many Basic Pokémon as he or she likes, put them onto his or her Bench, and shuffle his or her deck afterward. (You put your Pokémon on the Bench first.) Pichu is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, you may move any number of Fire Energy attached to your Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scorching Breath
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that is described in Chinese legends. It is said to race at an unbelievable speed.

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Surf Together
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon. Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

data.name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Panic Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hunter's Nails
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

abilities.name: Terraforming
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck and rearrange them as you like. This power can't be used if Machamp is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Iron Fist
attacks.text: Count the number of Pokémon you have in play with damage counters on them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of those Pokémon.

data.name: Yanma

attacks.name: Shockwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance. Then, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

data.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Electric Effect
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a Lightning Pokémon in addition to its existing types.

attacks.name: Thunder Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.

data.name: Charizard V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Chain Lightning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon isn't Colorless, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon of the same type as the Defending Pokémon (including your own).

data.flavorText: It stores electrical energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation.

data.name: Orbeetle VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Eerie Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: G-Max Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Energy Bomb
attacks.text: You may move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mystic Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Psychic Energy in play.

data.name: Tropius

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Dialga

attacks.name: Time Bellow
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flash Cannon
attacks.text: You may return all Energy cards attached to Dialga to your hand. If you do, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from the Defending Pokémon and shuffle that card into your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

data.name: Darumaka

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Very competitive, this Pokémon will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it.

abilities.name: Camouflage Pattern
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dustox by your opponent's Pokémon that is affected by 2 or more Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Smogscreen
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Chemical Scale
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Sweep Away
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

data.flavorText: Once it bites down, it won't let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.

data.name: Houndoom-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Melting Horn
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Grand Flame
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Torchic

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Magcargo

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

data.name: M Houndoom-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Inferno Fang
attacks.text: You may discard all Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Sporadic Sponging
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from Treecko.

data.name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flare Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

attacks.name: Double Blaze-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Fire Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 100 more damage, and this attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Delphox

abilities.name: Mystical Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Blaze Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

data.name: Alakazam-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Kinesis
abilities.text: When you play M Alakazam-EX from your hand to evolve this Pokémon, before it evolves, you may put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon and 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Suppression
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

data.name: Applin

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.

data.name: Inteleon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Snipe Shot
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Report
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Wobbuffet is an Evolved Pokémon, your opponent pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Wobbuffet.

attacks.name: Shadow Tag
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Kingler δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Fire Metal type.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Prop-up Pinchers
attacks.text: If Kingler has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Dewott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

attacks.name: Dark Splash
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Darkness Pokémon in play.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Hyper Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Moltres. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Moltres. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The flames on this legendary Pokémon's wings burn so brightly that they can make night seem like day.

abilities.name: Dowsing Code
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Porygon-Z G from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and shuffle them into your deck.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Charizard-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mega Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for M Charizard-EX, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Saturation
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Quagsire, remove all Special Conditions and 2 damage counters from Quagsire.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card attached to Quagsire but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Draconic Disaster
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.

attacks.name: Dread Storm-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Cloyster by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double Bubble
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads. If either of the coins is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: For each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's), flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Torkoal

abilities.name: Hot Snort
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Torkoal from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

data.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Vital Throw
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Machamp does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Hundred Furious Punches
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Fighting Energy attached to Machamp.

data.flavorText: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Larvesta

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

data.name: Virizion

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sacred Sword
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Sacred Sword during your next turn.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

abilities.name: Magnetic Field
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magnetic Force
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

abilities.name: Chaos Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Golduck is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Confused. This power can't be used if Golduck is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.
